Deficiency Narrative: Out of four staff EBI training reviewed, one was not current and three did not have documented EBI training every 6 months.
Correction Narrative: The operation met compliance by providing a copy of the caregivers/employees current EBI certificates and sending a response stating that a monthly review of all YES employees will be completed by the training department to ensure that each employee is compliant with EBI training requirements. In addition, the YES program manager will conduct 2 additional EBI training courses for YES program staff each month to ensure trainin compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course inspection it was found that the operation vaccinated a child in care that had a signed affidavit stating for the child not to be vaccinations.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance by the ACH YES Program Clinical manager retraining the Family Engagement Specialist and Clinical case manager at the YES program regarding the requirements around youth vaccination requirements as well as well as ensuing that they have access and login credentials to the ACH network to the due to the ACH VPN to have unlimited access to their email to ensure email communication remains uninterrupted during power outages and emergencies. Training logs were also provided with signatures.

Deficiency Narrative: After reviewing the video, it shows staff sitting at a table on their cell phone. Staff never look up to see the child leaving from the common area.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance by conducting a training on 1/28/2024 at the operation. Staff went over the importance of supervision. Training log was submitted. Training logs and staff sign in sheets can be found in the document library.

Deficiency Narrative: During the review staff reported that he told victim he was lucky he wasnt 18 because he would have beat his ass.
Correction Narrative:
The operation is receiving an extension until 1/6/2025 due to the corrective action form needing HR approval before signatures can be provided. 

The operation came into compliance on 1/2/2025 by providing a signature from the Supervisor showing proof that that the supervisor received counseling on the Corrective Action. 

Copy Of the signed form can be found in Document Library.

Deficiency Narrative: A review of a child's medication log did not have required name and signature of staff who administered medication.
Correction Narrative: Operation stated in regards to this deficiency that every staff member is encouraged to sign the back of a medication log within the medication record so that the associated staff initials can be utilized as confirmation of a successful medication administration.  In this case we believe that the staff did sign the back of multiple medication logs within the medication record but that the reviewing licensing representative did not credit the signature of said staff associated with the specific log in question. Operation is appealing decision.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care ran was absent from the facility 04/19, 04/20, 04/24, and an attempt on 04/25. The child stated that the running away was an attempt to obtain cigarettes. The incident report does not document how the operation planned to reduce the probability of additional absences.
Correction Narrative: Operation answered this deficiency stating that this  standard was in compliance due to the resident never left sight of staff who follow closely during the attempt and processed with the resident successfully as evidenced by his safe return. Operation stated they will appeal this decision concerning this standard

Deficiency Narrative: 2 of  2 child files reviewed did not have complete discharge summaries completed to include required information including circumstances of discharge, assessment of child needs, support resources and aftercare plans.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted plan stating that they intend to audit each and every chart following discharge within 72 hours to ensure all associated paperwork including the discharge summary is completed.

Deficiency Narrative: On May 7th Christopher P. was administer Trazodone by staff member ASA,. ASA did not document the time the medication was provided.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided plan indicating that they will add a target time to each medication log ensuring that if initials are provided this does indeed indicate the medication was given within a 30-minute window (15 minutes either side) of the target time.)  Should the medication be administered outside of the 30-minute window, an exact time will be provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff members at the operation failed to prevent a child in care from assaulting other children in care with an object.
Correction Narrative: Operation indicated that one specific adjustment they have made since this incident is to place Ukeru pads in the ERC gym to be used as another tool in the de-escalation process.

Deficiency Narrative: When a child had escalated behaviors, staff member pulled a child hair in order to gain compliance.
Correction Narrative: Operation response indicated that this in no way was proper EBI technique, because this grabbing of the childs hair was done not as a punishment but as an inappropriate knee jerk reaction to the staff member being grabbed by the hair by the child from behind, Standard 748.2307(6) does not apply and the appropriate standard that could have been cited actually covers Techniques staff members are prohibited from using on a child and includes, but is not limited to any technique designed to or likely to cause a child physical pain, 748.1119(2), would have been the correct standard to cite.   As such the standard that was cited in this deficiency does not apply and should be removed.  However, as stated previously the staff member who was in violation of implementing a prohibited technique has been suspended pending termination and will not have access to any children from this point forward.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was escalated and the staff member failed to use coping mechanisms listed on the service plan.
Correction Narrative: The case manager who writes the preliminary plans of service will be expanding on content to ensure that a variety of coping skills are listed and not simply the first two that come to the childs mind.

Deficiency Narrative: While under the supervision of caregivers an 11 year old stabbed a 13 year old in the chest and back with a stick causing an injury.
Correction Narrative: Operation indicated that due to the seriousness of the allegations, both staff members named in the RTB have been suspended pending the resolution of this investigation and will have no contact with any children at the shelter as a result until that time.

Deficiency Narrative: two of the three triggered reviews did not indicate that the child's case manager was present for the triggered review. The child's case manager must participate in the triggered review.
Correction Narrative: The agency modified their Triggered review signature page to include the title of the persons that are required to attend the triggered review and added a date line for when the notification was sent to the required parties. The new form will be discussed in their meeting to ensure that everyone is aware of the process.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not use any measure to encourage the children to not run away.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided response to this deficiency including IR report showing that staff did re-direct youth. Operation is requesting an administrative review indicating that this deficiency was issued in error.

Deficiency Narrative: The staff conducted a search of the youths' room, took cell phones, and did not document the search.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided response to this deficiency including incident report showing the search was documented, operation stated that they would also be filing an appeal to this deficiency as they indicated that it was issued in error.

Deficiency Narrative: A new preliminary service plan was not completed when a child discharged but then was readmitted to the operation several days later.

Two debriefings do not include required documentation such as what occurred while the child was away, where the child went, and the child's activities. One debriefing does not include the child's condition upon returning.

One initial service plan is missing several pieces of required information such as the child's personal trauma history, trauma triggers, plans for educating on STD's and human reproduction, and plans for preparation for independent living.
A child's chronic condition of being epileptic or having seizures was not on the exterior of the file and was not clearly visidble in the file.
Correction Narrative: This child is no longer in placement. An inspection to the operation was completed on 06/06/2023 to determine compliance with this standard. 3 out 3 records reviewed were in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The unauthorized absence log is missing how long the child was gone or did not return, the name of the caregiver responsible for the child at the time the childs absence was discovered, the intake report number and the number of the police report.
Correction Narrative: The Inspector received an email from the director with an updated log to include all the required information for the unauthorized absence log.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the service plans reviewed did not document the supervision in the preliminary service plan for the child.
Correction Narrative: The director sent an email stating that an audit all current client preliminary service plans will be conducted to ensure all fields are complete. Going forward, these will be reviewed for thorough completion during the existing monthly record review process.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children were seen going in and out of the closet.

One caregivers trauma informed care training expired on 5/3/2022. 

Note: This was corrected at inspection due to the staff completing the training during the inspection.

One caregivers normalcy training expired on 5/3/2022. 

Note: This was corrected at inspection due to the staff completing the training during the inspection.
A debriefing was not conducted with 24 hours following an unauthorized absences.
Correction Narrative: Operation director completed a meeting with all staff on 6/28/2022 to discuss the requirement to complete a follow up debriefing when youth go absent without permission within 24 hours of the youth returning. A copy of the meeting agenda and sign in sheet was emailed.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was left outside of the operation.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received with an attachment with the operations YES overnight room and and Facility Check Protocols. 

1.	 All youth should be in bed no later than 10:00PM, youth may be awake in their rooms but should not be in the common areas unless we are meeting with them or assisting them with something.  
2.	Room checks should be completed every 0 to 15 minutes and should be completed in random intervals. Please make sure that we are staggering our check times to ensure that we are not developing patterns of supervision that the youth can pick up on throughout the night.  Checks should never be completed in the same time intervals to ensure that they are random, and they should never exceed 15 minutes.  
3.	Please make sure that at least one member of the team is positioned where they can visually see the entry door to the shelter program when not completing rooms checks to ensure that we can see anyone approaching or attempting to access the front entry door. 
4.	Headphones should not be worn during working hours to ensure that staff can hear the phone, doorbells, or anything else that may require their attention.  This also allows us to hear and respond to all emergencies as needed.   
5.	While conducting a room checks please make sure that we are checking the porches of the shelter to ensure that no youth or visitors are outside of the shelter throughout the night.  These checks should be documented on the same check sheet being completed for the rooms checks. 
6.	If we have a youth go AWOP during nightshift, please follow the YES AWOP and Runaway protocol.  If we have a youth go AWOP or if we have any youth on current runaway status, please make sure we notify campus security immediately so that they are aware of the situation.

Deficiency Narrative: Children engaged in inappropriate contact due to the adequate supervision of the caregiver.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's bedroom does not have blinds, curtains or anything covering the window to provide privacy.
Correction Narrative: One child's bedroom does not have blinds, curtains or anything covering the window to provide privacy.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver slapped a child in care in the face.
Children in care were able to gain access to staff keys and be unsupervised in the gym for several hours.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: Two chidren did not have a debriefing within 24 hours of returning to the operation following an unauthorized absence.
Correction Narrative: A refresher training was conducted on how to properly complete an incident report including how to complete the debriefing. Meeting agenda was provided and will be uploaded to SharePoint. The operation also implemented a new procedure requiring the Director to ensure the debriefing section is completed prior to approving submitted incident reports.

Deficiency Narrative: One child was restrained and there was no EBI post discussion with the child and the staff involved.
Correction Narrative: A refresher training was conducted on how to properly complete an incident report including how to debrief with youth following a containment.  Meeting agenda was provided and will be uploaded to SharePoint. The operation also implemented a new procedure requiring the Director to ensure the debriefing section is completed prior to approving submitted incident reports.

Deficiency Narrative: One medication had two separate medication logs for the same medication prescribed. One medication log had documented medication given prior to iit being administered.
Correction Narrative: Operation Registered Nurse is not conducting weekly medication audits to identify any systematic errors and create a plan to address them.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's bedroom has been without window blinds for a month.
Correction Narrative: This standard was found to be compliant. Blinds were observed in the bedroom.

Deficiency Narrative:
During the walk through a broken exit sign with exposed wire and broken furniture with exposed nails were found  the gym that the children had access to. Also in the bedroom two pollows did not have pollow cases. In one room a dresser drawer was missing.
Pictures were taken
Correction Narrative:
During the walk through a broken exit sign with exposed wire and broken furniture with exposed nails were found  the gym that the children had access to. Also in the bedroom two pillows did not have pillow cases. In one room a dresser drawer was missing.
Pictures were taken

Note: A follow up inspection was conducted and the broken exit sign had been repaired. Pillow cases were observed on all pillows and the broken furniture had been removed and discarded.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was allowed to intervene with another child who was destroying property at the operation.  Staff did not intervene but stayed outside of the room as both children were in the room and one child was hitting the walls and door with a metal pole.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be compliant. Staff were provided a refresher training on the basics of supervision and how to provide safe and supportive supervision when working with youth with the potential for high risk behaviors. Staff interviewed confirmed that training was provided and meeting agenda was provided and uploaded to SharePoint.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver implemented a restraint when there was no emergency situation and the child posed no risk to himself or others.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation (Inspection #3831071) The employee involved is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver uses inappropriate language in the presence of children in care.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation (Inspection #3831071) The employee involved is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver used an inappropriate restraint as a form of discipline and not during a crisis.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation (Inspection #3831071) The employee involved is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver placed a child in an uncomfortable position by placing her arm around his neck to escort him to his room.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation (Inspection #3831071) The employee involved is no longer employed at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: Hot water in one of the boys bathroom was observed to not be available.
Correction Narrative: Operation administrator provided an emailed copy of the work order showing that the water pressure in the boys hallway bathroom sink been fixed by maintenance on 2/10/2021.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver pushed a child and blocked the entrance preventing children from coming back inside the operation.
Correction Narrative: Program manager and Human Resources Director met with the individual involved and provided additional coaching and presented a corrective action plan. The corrective action plan was signed by staff and noted that the staff involved was retrained and signed copies of child abuse prevention and intervention, agency wide policies and procedures, employee handbook and physical discipline protocol. The physical discipline protocol was reviewed with all staff at the operation and a copy of the signature sheet was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: The unauthorized absence log does not include all required information.
Correction Narrative: Operation administrator provided an updated copy of the unauthorized absence log with all required information documented.
